caption: This place was an unexpected surprise.  We passed it by chance, in the area we stayed in for our honeymoon.  And it was so pretty, so tranquil, quite romantic, and an absolute hidden gem of a garden in the city.  Lovely way to spend an afternoon in the sunshine, and at the time of our visit, there was an amazing collection of photographs from around the world, from a time when cameras were brand new and so much of the world was unexplored.  I'd recommend and would go back, next time we're in Paris.

Museum is about Kahn and the photography and film he had collected. Gardens are the highlight, with different sections for different parts of world. Natures disney land in a small park, or garden behind the museum. I went into winter. Beautiful any time if year. 9‚Ç¨ to get in. Handicap accessible, but some paths in the garden are most certainly not.

The Albert Kahn Museum is renowned for its stunning Japanese garden, offering a serene and beautifully structured space that captivates visitors of all ages.  The garden‚Äôs tranquility and meticulous design rival even those found in Japan, making it a hidden gem for lovers of Japanese culture and nature.  The peaceful environment provides an ideal retreat for families, with plenty to admire in its artful landscaping. Whether you‚Äôre looking for a quiet escape or a cultural experience, this garden is well worth a visit when you have some free time.
I was surprisingly shocked how beautiful it is here even during winter. Definitely recommend coming üòå For me, since I am under 26 y.o, it was free.

A secret hidden place with a beautiful garden, the museum gives you a sneak peak into the various contributions of Albert Kahn who experimented with plant dyes and seeds,  built a garden, after getting inspired from his visits to Japan.  Reminded me of the Monet garden in Giverny

Wonderful, beautiful and peaceful place. The gardens are amazing and you can totally forget about the stress of the city life there. I totally recommend it. I'd say it's better in the morning since there's less people.

A botanical gem located on the western outskirts of Paris. An invaluable place for lovers of nature, photography, and travel. I was there for the first time this fall, and since I live nearby on the other side of the river, I intend to return to see the garden in winter and spring...

A hidden gem just outside of Paris. It's very convenient to get to (just next to the Metro station) and isn't very crowded. The museum is pretty small but the gardens were the highlight of the visit. It's great for an escape to nature at the outskirts of Paris.
The garden is amazing for some fresh air and beautiful scenery, definitely recommended for a quite peaceful walk!

The museum is not big and consists of thousands of photos from around the world(mostly Europe). It has a beautiful garden which includes two parts the Japanese part and the general part with a small waterfall. The Japanese part is exceptionally beautiful and inspired to visit Japan.

Delightful Japanese water feature garden, old trees as in a For√™t de Vosges, all created in the bustle of Paris, separate exhibits on glaciers and photography, all worth a tranquil visit! lunch at the restaurant could be improved.

The museum was really nice and interesting. The garden was gorgeous. We also liked the little Deliciosa Caffe, fresh Portuguese home made food. I recommend to visit this place at springtime or in autumn.
An amazing place, you feel that you traveled to the past. The garden full of beautiful plants and flowers. You must visit.

A big yes if you are looking for a creative Garden. This place was incredibly well maintained ‚ú®. Lots of impressive landscaping. This garden has so many "wow" areas like water bodies, Bonsai trees‚ù§Ô∏è. It's a Very calm and many photogenic areas . Do visit it üëçüèª!

The contents of the museum within were not the highlight of the visit for us - they mostly contain photography from a long-ranging around the world project that Albert Kahn sponsored, to be honest I think the exhibits could use some editing down and deeper explanation. But the gardens - wow! Have you ever seen a mini-forest that looks like a theater set because it‚Äôs so carefully swept and maintained? Not a leaf out of place but somehow a relaxed beauty nevertheless. There are various Japanese gardens, which I wish there was more explanation about (extremely enjoyable without it but I know there is a lot of history and tradition behind them which I would have love to learn about), all gorgeous and immaculately kept.
Cute musee, but the best part is walking in the gardens .
Beautiful place, where you can enjoy nature and calm atmosphere
Lovely place to visit, nice for a date or just to chill

Great museum but even better garden! The exposition isn‚Äôt quite big but the garden is stunning : the English part, the Japanese part or the rosary are all so well preserved and breathtaking, especially in the summer. The only inconvenient I found was the location. It‚Äôs quite far from Paris and if too far from where you‚Äôre staying it might not be worth it to go all over Boulogne just for this museum. Otherwise, if you‚Äôre going to the vois de Boulogne anyway, do check the Albert Kahn foundation !

I really enjoyed the visit. The museum is quite small but its garden is very charming et worth to see! Ideally visit on spring, summer or autumn. Spoiler: they have a Photo Booth (not print but it will send yours photos to your mail) on the 2nd floor (premier √©tage en fran√ßais ü´¢) ‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs beautiful there, the art , the garden! You travel to the past when you get there. It worth visiting it.

A nice surprise a few metro stops away from Paris center. Museum content was quite light (one could have liked some more information about Albert-Kahn himself or why the garden is designed as it is). We bought our tickets on site on a Saturday afternoon.  As such, the garden and the building (by Kengo Kuma!) are the highlights of my visit. Absolutely stunning.  Little gem, as many prople don‚Äôt even know about this place.

I love this place. Going there through the seasons and seeing nature change is one of my Parisian pleasures. The only thing that I regret since the remodeling is that it is not possible to see the old videos, but rather in a very annoyingly curated series of themes, that do not provide the historical sense of previous set up.
Nice museum. The temporary exhibition was really interesting with old photographs from early 20th travels. Great garden (Japanese and french styles) !

The photo museum gives a glimpse of how culture was captured back then and its gardens offers a fantastic and surreal feeling of how gardens are like from different countries. Exquisite and detailed in its execution. Recommended to go with loved ones or kids.
What a wonderful Japanese garden, and a very interesting museum.  You can also eet great Portugese cuisine. A wonderful day!

The garden has just been reopened to the public after a period of renovation. The first impression when entering this garden is like coming to another world. There is a Japanese garden, French garden and English garden on the museum. Especially Japanese garden with sophisticated design, zen garden, lake with koi fish. Each corner of the garden is arranged according to the meaning of life. Wooden bridges are the highlight of this garden.
Incredibly spiritual place. Hidden japanese paradise in Paris. Very recommended for all nature lovers.

I visited the Albert Kahn Museum today with a friend, and we were very disappointed with our experience. We both booked tickets priced at 8 euros each, and upon arrival, we were informed that the gardens were closed. As international students who traveled all the way from Paris, we were particularly excited to see the gardens, which are a major highlight of the museum.  It would have been fair to notify visitors of the garden closure in advance, either through the website or at the point of ticket purchase. This information would have allowed us to make an informed decision about our visit. The lack of communication regarding the garden closure led to a very disappointing experience.  We hope this feedback helps improve the experience for future visitors.
lovely museum and gardens to spend the afternoon, well maintained gardens with lots to explore and plenty of seating to relax
Beautiful garden, wish there were more signs about plants and flowers in the place

Very beautiful. Stunning. The museum has a small photography collection, it's nice, old photos from around the planet. Nice to see big diversity in one place. However, the garden is the prime attraction here. Super beautiful Japanese style garden and traditional Japanese houses. Very peaceful and beautiful to walk around. There is a small bamboo area and another area as if its a wild forest. All that near a metro station in Paris. I highly recommend this place.
Just beautiful gardens. A place of peace. Albert had his fung shui top of mind when he designed this lovely reprieve!
Beautiful garden! The area with a Japanese garden is really amazing. It's very quiet and nice there.

I went for the contemporary architecture of Kengo Kuma which was restrained, modest and perfectly suited for this little museum of 18000 images, collected circa 1912 to ‚Äúdocument the world.‚Äô The garden, founded by Kahn himself, was the real treat. Ten stars. A little beautiful piece of Japan, a few French forests. Lush and impeccable, one wants to get lost and never leave. Alas Alice, time to grow up.
It was in a really quiet area, well kept and clean. It was also well organized
The gardens are superbly designed and taken care of. What a great place to visit!
Nice Japanese garden outside and many historic photos inside
